intro: Palala surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam palala, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
